intro: Dichapetalum pallidum, commonly known as the pale dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, while its flowers are clustered in racemose inflorescences. The pale dichapetalum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland and savanna habitats.
